extendedInfo.description: @Voice Aloud Reader reads aloud the text displayed in Android apps, e.g. web pages, news articles, long emails, PDF files and more. IMPORTANT: You need Text-To-Speech engine and voices installed on your device to use this app. If you don't have it yet, pickup from Play Store Acapela, Ivona or SVOX TTS package. You may use more than one if you want.Features:* Click "Share" or "Send by Email" button/menu item in any app to send text to @Voice Aloud Reader for aloud reading over speakers or a headset.* If "Share" is not available, copy text in another app and paste it into @Voice for aloud reading.* Option to instantly read aloud text copied to clipboard.* Open text, PDF or HTML files from Android file system for reading aloud.* Save articles opened in @Voice to files for later listening. Construct listening lists of many articles for uninterrupted listening one after the other. Order the list as needed, e.g. more important articles first.* Dropbox sync! Enable, then build your list on one device, e.g. a tablet, then listen on your phone. Or from your computer, use File/Save As - "HTML only" function in the browser, save to @Voice Dropbox folder, then listen on your phone.* Easily control speech generator volume, pitch and rate of speech.* Pause/resume speech as needed with wired or Bluetooth headset buttons, plus click Next/Previous buttons to jump by sentence, long-click the same buttons to switch to the next/previous article on a list.* Can automatically recognize the language of an article and use appropriate TTS voice, if available, or set your preferred voices manually with "Select language" menu item.* Options for additional pause between paragraph, start talking as soon as a new article is loaded or wait for a button press, start/stop talking when wired headset plug is inserted/removed.* Optional sleep timer to stop speech after a given timeout.ABOUT PERMISSIONS:The full Internet access is needed because the âShareâ function from web browsers and any news reading apps I tried, sends us only the URL address (http://something...). They do not send the full text of articles, so @Voice has to download the article from the Internet to be able to read it aloud or save for later reading. Only by using Copy text function in one app, and pasting it in @Voice, or by saving the full text in one app to storage and opening a file in @Voice, you could avoid Internet connection, but this is not very convenient. Also - the new Dropbox sync function needs Internet access, of course. There is no way to avoid it.Tags: TTS, Text to Speech, read aloud, speak aloud, PDF, PDF read aloud, Talking, Type to Speak, Type and Say, Document Reader, Webpage Reader, reader, Type to Talk, speach, txt, "Text to Speech", voice, reading, text to voice, read to me

reviews.title: Unable to close application
reviews.comment: Unable to close application

reviews.title: Daily use. Very good.
reviews.comment: Awesome Now! Support this developer\'s efforts for sure. Excellent support. Thank you very much! I know this is your first move to PDF so I am totally encouraged. Refreshing and HIGHLY USEFUL. Every day for me. Keep up the good work and please overlook all of the exclamation points. I am just super stoked because this app helps me get my work and studies done now.
reviews.author: Miles Fry

reviews.title: Gs3
reviews.comment: Like it but wish I could read books and turn it off
reviews.author: tina d

reviews.title: Looks good for text and html files
reviews.comment: As above. If it could play pdf files as well, I just about wouldn\'t need anything else.
reviews.author: T Williams

reviews.title: Almost perfect
reviews.comment: This scores about a 4.8 for me. The only thing more I could ask is a slightly prettier UI, but love it all.   Particularly appreciate that I can zoom in on text so that it\'s very large during playback which helps when driving and listening to articles when the TTS says something I don\'t quite understand.
reviews.author: DC Cann

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Now I can listen to my articles while taking care of other things!! This app is genius
reviews.author: Michelle Bucur

reviews.title: It\'s good.
reviews.comment: The only thing is that it some times goes of on its own. It freaked my wife out yesterday.lol.
reviews.author: Matthew Trevino

reviews.comment: Good
reviews.author: Jude Marius

reviews.title: Best I have come across
reviews.comment: Simple to use... Just make sure to install a good \'text to speech\' voice. An option to start up in the folder of your choice would be nice.. but considering all the other good features this is still the best.
reviews.author: Robert Lee

reviews.title: Thanks it works now!!
reviews.comment: Was working perfectly a week ago, but now crashes before it even begins downloading the text. Then goes on an endless crash loop. Tried clearing app data, but no luck.  Edit: Unable to send a report as the crash seems to be within the app, which causes the subsystem to be loaded again in an endless loop. The only part of the app that renders is a notifaction box regarding the crash every 20 seconds.  Version is Froyo for Moto  Defy.  Edit: Fixed by the update. Working perfectly now.
reviews.author: Rahul Kadavill

reviews.title: Thank you much Love it, get\'s the work done.
reviews.comment: Really makes things easier.
reviews.author: Dexter Solis

reviews.title: Just what I needed
reviews.comment: Love it!!
reviews.author: Jenna McCall

reviews.title: Pdf files are not supported
reviews.comment: Although the application is fantastic i am very much disappointed that it won\'t support pdf files.
reviews.author: Ganesh Kanade

reviews.comment: Finally a tts synth that works for large blocks of text!!
reviews.author: Veysel Cetiner

reviews.comment: Nice software
reviews.author: saeed alrumaithi

reviews.comment: Good app for webpages. Efforts &hard work behind making this app is seen. But not reading normal pdf text. plz make it usable for simple pdf text atleast. And I choose this app just because one reason that I could see response from makers on user\'s comments.\tI would love it if this will read my pdf text or study material. thank you.
reviews.author: Nachiketa Raval

reviews.title: Better than Speakit!
reviews.comment: Being new to Android, I was fruitlessly looking for an equivalent to the best iOS TTS app Speakit.  Thankfully I found this gem!
reviews.author: Cliff Berry

reviews.title: Full featured and good support for 3rd party voices
reviews.comment: I use this program ask the time.  I use icons voice to replace the crap one that came stock on my phone.  Combined with web browser, Dropbox, and free e-books, this makes my commute educational.
reviews.author: Steve Rowe

reviews.title: God bless
reviews.comment: Great app.

reviews.title: You have done well.
reviews.comment: Is a wonderful apps.
